page.title: 04Mr. Morgan -The Shepherd
page.content: At Whitehouse Farm there are 2,500 sheep.Mr.Morgan and his assistant are in charge of the sheep.He works about 40-45 hours a week,but even longer in the lambing eason.Generally 1,700 lambs are born each spring, but in the south many lambs die in the lambing season.A lamb weighs 40kgs. and a sheep weighs 75kgs.When the lambs are new,they are fed 500kgs.of hay a day,straw,grass,turnips or processed food.A ram costs Â£300,they are dearer than sheep.Sheep cost about Â£100.If a sheep dies it will cost Â£75 to replace it.They have their feet clipped once or twice every year.Some people think that sheep are stupid,but Mr.Morgan said that they are not as stupid as people think they are.An average sheep lives up to five or six years.The oldest sheep is six years old.He said that sheep can live for up to 15 years
